comment.name: Comment
comment.text:
Afternoon Report: 2:15 PM

Hi Sugarloafers!

Stellar snow today. Trails were groomed to *chef's kiss*, and the snow was so soft it felt like you were carving through butter. The cord was so good it allowed you to lay out carves that defied physics. All while we had blue skies and no wind. Temps were high, but the vibes were higher. I mean, come on, things can't get much better than this.

Groomers are at it again tonight! They are hitting pretty much all of the same stuff as last night. They are also adding Flume to the mix.

Lifts are going to be the same tomorrow as they were today.

For passholders with first tracks access, Superquad and Skyline will be your lifts for tomorrow.

Somehow, it's going to get even warmer tomorrow, but only by a few degrees. Very little wind, but we'll have clouds in the sky. I even hear rumors of snow. Now I don't want to promise anything, but just keep that in the back of your noggin that there is potential for a few snow showers tomorrow, adding a nice little layer to soften trails even more.

You deserve a sweet treat for skiing all day. Head on over to the King Pine room from 3-4 PM for an Ice Cream Social. Or treat yourself to a beverage at Widowmaker, and join us for après live music by Jason McClure from 3-6 PM.

Newschoolers Gathering is coming to Sugarloaf on Saturday, February 21st, featuring K2 pro athlete and Sugarloafer Keegan Kilbride. This event is freestyle skiing the way it should be. No egos, no pressure, just park laps with your pals and some of the best skiers and riders in the game. Registration is $10 per person online in advance or on the day of, check it out through our quick links.

Stay stoked,
Shannon

comment.name: Uphill
comment.text:
Uphill travel is open via the West Mountain Route, the SuperQuad Route, and the Bucksaw Route.

Visit the Uphill Policy page for detailed directions.
 
Note: All day-ticket uphill travelers must pick up their 1-day wristband prior to starting their ascent with Guest Services located in the base lodge. Your wristband must be visible at all times. For more information, visit the Uphill Policy page.

trail.name: Lower Sheer Boom
trail.comment: Please note Lower Sheer Boom refers to the section between Tote X-Cut and Peavy X-Cut

trail.name: Upper Narrow Gauge
trail.comment: Closed at Gin Pole for racing

trail.name: Upper Stub's Trail
trail.comment: MTB trails need to fill in a little more

park.name: Drop Line Park
park.comment: "Fun Zone" featuring 16 low-angle bumps, spines, rollers, and banked turns
